definition: pocket/bag/to wrap up or hold in a bag/to move in a circle/to canvas or solicit/to take responsibility for/to disclose in detail/combat armor (old)

sentences.english: Frank jerked a dirty blue handkerchief from his trousers pocket .
sentences.chinese: 富蘭克慌亂地從褲兜里拉出一條骯髒的藍手帕。

sentences.english: He carried his hands in his pockets.
sentences.chinese: 他的手一直插在褲兜裏。

sentences.english: He stood up and felt for his wallet in his pocket.
sentences.chinese: 他站起身，然後摸了摸褲兜裏的皮夾子。

sentences.english: Pulling out a hammer he had stuffed into his shorts, Hughes smashed a rear side window.
sentences.chinese: 休斯拿出之前塞在褲兜裏的錘子，向後側窗使勁砸去。

sentences.english: The authority said it was issuing the garment to all airport officials.
sentences.chinese: 該機構表示，將向所有機場工作人員發放無褲兜制服。

sentences.english: THE NEXT DAY I was overseeing the pocket installation when something returned to me.
sentences.chinese: 第二天，在看着他上褲兜的時候，我回憶起了一些事。

sentences.english: Hands on trouser pocket inside, it is so leisurely walk, thoughts fly with.
sentences.chinese: 手放在褲兜裏，就這樣悠閒地走着，思緒飛着。

sentences.english: Pockets on the back of pants should be larger.
sentences.chinese: 褲子的後褲兜應該大一點。

sentences.english: First, he was wrapped, in a vine leaf, and put into a warm trousers' pocket.
sentences.chinese: 他被用葡萄葉子給包了起來放進了溫暖的褲兜。

sentences.english: No slouching, hands out of pockets, and head held up high.
sentences.chinese: 不要沒精打采的，把手從褲兜裏掏出來，把頭擡高。
